Project Description: Out of about 141 m. Ha of net area sown in the country, about 65 million hectare (or 45%) is presently covered under irrigation. Substantial dependency on rainfall makes cultivation in unirrigated areas a high risk, less productive profession. Empirical evidences suggest that assured or protective irrigation encourages farmers to invest more in farming technology and inputs leading to productivity enhancement and increased farm income. Government is committed to giving high priority to water security. It will complete the long pending irrigation projects on priority and launch the ‘Pradhan Mantri Krishi Sinchayee Yojana’ with the motto of ‘Har khet ko Paani’.

Project Description: The link road from Ursu Nallah to village Ursu having a length of 4.5km, bifurcates from Garsa Shilagarh road of NHPC near village Jhuni. The area Lies in the interior of Kullu District and village is having a population of 400 souls. The people of the area have to face hardship to get basic facilities due to non availability of road. No government land other than forest land available, as the whole land other than private land has been declared as forest land in Kullu District. Hence it is not possible to avoid forest land falling in this road project.

Project Description:
The total forest land required for the construction of Solang-II (100kW) Micro Hydel Electric Project is 00-15-75 Hectare and is located in Village -Solang, Tehsil- Manali, Distt- Kullu, Forest Division-Kullu, Himachal Pradesh on Gharath Nallah. The project components i.e. Trench weir, Feeder pipe, Desilting tank, spillway, Penstock, Power House, Muck Dumping Area, Tail Race, and transmission line  will be constructed on the proposed forest land.

                             The water of Gharath stream will be diverted by the construction of a diversion weir and conveyed through a closed conveyance channel/pipe of approximate length of 8 mtr to the Desilting tank from where the water will be carried by a Penstock to the power house where the turbines and generators shall generate 100kW electric power. The power generated shall be evacuated through Underground Cable of 11kV to be solid tapped with HPSEBL transmission system.
Project Name: Solang-II MHEP
Alternative Site Examined: YES
Organization Street: VPO- Bhanag, Village- Shanag, Tehsil- Manali, Distt- Kullu, Himachal Pradesh

Project Description: The proposed project is a River Bed mining project for the extraction of Stone, Sand and Bajri for open sale, located at Khasra Nos. 344 measuring 06-18-05 Bighas. (Private Land, River Bed) falling in Mauza Firnoo, Tehsil  Karsog, District  Mandi, Himachal Pradesh.The mining lease area lies in the riverbed of River Satluj. River Satluj enters the District Mandi near village Firnoo at an elevation of 852 meters above mean sea level and covers a distance of 80 Kms. in village Mandi up to village Shamlehu where the elevation drops to 529.70 meters above mean sea level. The highest point of the mining lease area is 764 meters above MSL and the lowest point is 761 meters above MSL and the average width is 50 to 80 meters..

Project Description: Government of Himachal Pradesh has envisaged to develop helipad at various locations in state. Bharmour  is one of the site selected for development of helipod. bharmour valley with its headquarter at bharmour is a far flung tribal valley of Himachal Pradesh having serene climate and untouched natural beauty and is the perfect area for tourism. Due to far going nature of valley, access remains limited as terrain is tough and transport through roads remain perilous due to snow for over 6 months. Development of heliport will enable tourists to travel from Kullu, Chamba, Shimla etc to the valley via air and will lead to development of tourism in the valley. Project Description: Construction of link road from Dharogra Daloghatti to Kanda Lunu Km 0/00 to 2/700in Gram Panchayat Dharogra, Block Basantpur, Tehsil Sunni, Distt. Shimla, H.P.	The villages Kanda, Lunu are un-connected from road. The land/soil of the area is very fertile in growing cash crops viz, Apples, potatoes, Pulses, Peas& Seasonal Crops etc. But at present in the absence of motorable road, the people of these villages are facing great difficulties in carrying their cash crops timely to the market and also in carrying the essential commodities/daily needs etc.especially in view of the rugged terrain and steep slope. They have to pay huge amounts on account of manual carriage of cash crops and essential commodities, the local products cannot be sent to the market well in time and the growers cannot get the proper values of their cash crops with the result that the people of the area are becoming poor to poorer day by day. Hence, the link road to these villages has been proposed .
Project Name: Construction of link road from  Dharogra Daloghatti to Kanda Lunu km 0/00 to 2/700
Alternative Site Examined: YES
Organization Street: Engineer-in-Chief HPPWD Nirman Bhawan Nigam Vihar Shimla Engineer-in-Chief HPPWD Nirman Bhawan Nigam Vihar Shimla

Project Description: This proposal has been formulated to provide road link to substantially backward area ituated in a beautiful valley. It is situated in Tehsil Sadar in Distt. Mandi (HP). This proposed road bifurcates from Dhuan Devi to Lajhukar Road and lead to Pandoh via Jammu Village. The proposed road connects the Dhuan Devi villages to Pandoh. At present the mule transport is only mode available for transporting the goods etc, the area is quite rich in the production of cash crops and agriculture production such as Maize potato rice & seasonal vegetable etc. The land is very fertile. But heavy cost of transportation for export o surplus production and different marketing position restrain people from taking farming in an whole hearted way as such their living standard is also poor.
Project Name: C/O LINK ROAD FROM DHUAN DEVI JAMMU KM 0/0 TO 5/500

Project Description:
Construction of link road from Kanohroo to Village Galah Km 0/00 to 2/970,in Gram Panchayat Dharogra, Block Basantpur, Tehsil Sunni, Distt. Shimla, H.P.
	The villages Galahand Saraiha areun-connected from road.The land/soil of the area is very fertile in growing cash crops viz, Apples, potatoes, Pulses, Peas& Seasonal Crops etc. But at present in the absence of motorable road, the people of this village are facing great difficulties in carrying their cash crops timely to the market and also in carrying the essential commodities/daily needs etc.especially in view of the rugged terrain and steep slope. They have to pay huge amounts on account of manual carriage of cash crops and essential commodities, the local products cannot be sent to the market well in time and the growers cannot get the proper values of their cash crops with the result that the people of the area are becoming poor to poorer day by day. Hence, the link road to this village has been proposed
Last Visible Status: Pending at Nodal Officer for Recommendation

Project Description:
The Himachal Pradesh Government has Sanctioned the project under RIDF-XXI-2015-16 for Rs. 581.04 lacs for proposed the Construction of link road from village Trimality to Devna km. 0/0 to 8/0 under NABARD.
The total length of proposed alignment is 8.000 kms with average width of 6.00 meter. The road alignment passes through forest and private land and forest land. The portion from km. 6/800 to 8/0 will be passes through forest land and portion from km. 0/0 to 6/800 will passes through private land. The road passes through the private land has already been constructed in km. 0/0 to 6/800 by the HPPWD, under NABARD Head. The remaining length of the road will also passes through the private land but, in a length of 1.200 kms, the kisam of land is Nakabil Jangal Ban, which attracts the FCA provision 1980. Hence 1.200 kms for which diversion of land is being sought. The total area 4.80 hectare will be required for the construction of this road in which 0.72 hectare area of forest land.

Project Description: Government of Himachal Pradesh has envisaged to develop heliports at various locations in state. Holi  is one of the site selected for development of heliport. holi  valley with its headquarter at holi  is a far flung tribal valley of Himachal Pradesh having serene climate and untouched natural beauty and is the perfect area for tourism. Due to far going nature of valley, access remains limited as terrain is tough and transport through roads remain perilous due to snow for over 6 months. Development of heliport will enable tourists to travel from  Chamba, Shimla etc to the valley via air and will lead to development of tourism in the valley. It will also lead to local employment during construction and operation phase of the project.

Project Description: Government of Himachal Pradesh has envisaged to develop heliports at various locations in state. Holi  is one of the site selected for development of heliport. holi  valley with its headquarter at holi  is a far flung tribal valley of Himachal Pradesh having serene climate and untouched natural beauty and is the perfect area for tourism. Due to far going nature of valley, access remains limited as terrain is tough and transport through roads remain perilous due to snow for over 6 months. Development of heliport will enable tourists to travel from  Chamba, Shimla etc to the valley via air and will lead to development of tourism in the valley. It will also lead to local employment during construction and operation phase of the project.
Last Visible Status: Pending at DFO For Compliance Review
Project Name: c/o heliport at Holi sub tehsil Holi District Chamba h.p

Project Description:
M/s Shree Siddi Vinayak Forging Pvt. Ltd. is an existing Steel Manufacturing Unit located at Village Nangal Uparla, Nalagarh-Swarghat Road, Tehsil Nalagarh, District Solan (H.P). Currently, the existing industrial unit deals with the manufacturing of Ingots @60,000 TPA with 2 Induction Furnaces of capacity 8 TPH & 12 TPH.
Now, the project proponent has proposed expansion by upgrading the existing Induction furnace of capacity 8 TPH to 15 TPH & merging the Rolling Mill unit (M/s Shree Siddi Vinayak TOR Pvt. Ltd.). However, 12 TPH Induction Furnace will remain same.
Thus, after expansion, the overall production capacity of the industrial unit will become 1,20,000 TPA of TMT Bars with 2 Induction Furnaces of capacity 12 TPH & 15 TPH and existing Rolling Mill. The total area of the industrial unit will become 26,525.62 sq.m (6.55 acres or 2.65 ha).

Project Description:
M/s Shree Siddi Vinayak Forging Pvt. Ltd. is an existing Steel Manufacturing Unit located at Village Nangal Uparla, Nalagarh-Swarghat Road, Tehsil Nalagarh, District Solan (H.P). Currently, the existing industrial unit deals with the manufacturing of Ingots @60,000 TPA with 2 Induction Furnaces of capacity 8 TPH & 12 TPH.
Now, the project proponent has proposed expansion by upgrading the existing Induction furnace of capacity 8 TPH to 15 TPH & merging the Rolling Mill unit (M/s Shree Siddi Vinayak TOR Pvt. Ltd.). However, 12 TPH Induction Furnace will remain same.
Thus, after expansion, the overall production capacity of the industrial unit will become 1,20,000 TPA of TMT Bars with 2 Induction Furnaces of capacity 12 TPH & 15 TPH and existing Rolling Mill. The total area of the industrial unit will become 26,525.62 sq.m (6.55 acres or 2.65 ha).

Project Description: 3RD India Reserve Battalion has a sanctioned strength of about 927 police personnel of different ranks i.e. Commandant to Constable. Project Description:
Construction of link road from DGBR road Pipltu to Pandoa temple km 0/00 to 2/100 , Gram panchayat Bag, block Basantpur , tehsil Sunni, distt. Shimla H.P.
The villages Pandoa and Sainj are un-connected from road. The land/soil of the area is very fertile in growing cash crops viz, Apples, potatoes, Pulses, Peas& Seasonal Crops etc. But at present in the absence of motorable road, the people of this village are facing great difficulties in carrying their cash crops timely to the market and also in carrying the essential commodities/daily needs etc. especially in view of the rugged terrain and steep slope. They have to pay huge amounts on account of manual carriage of cash crops and essential commodities, the local products cannot be sent to the market well in time and the growers cannot get the proper values of their cash crops with the result that the people of the area are becoming poor to poorer day by day. Hence, the link road to this village has been proposed.
Last Visible Status: Pending at DFO for Scrutiny and Recommendation

Project Description: The proposed Baggi Power project will harness the head available between Pandoh Reservoir  Level  of Sundernagar  Hydel  Channel  at  Baggi.  At  present  this  hydro  energy  is  dissipated  through a stilling basin downstream of Baggi Control Works (BCW). The existing by-pass tunnel of dia 6.1 m will be used as a headrace tunnel for feeding the powerhouse. The gate being used for closing the by-pass tunnel will be used as an emergency gate for closing the powerhouse is a run-of-river scheme utilizing a variable head from 21.34m to 49.54m depending upon the discharge  in  Pandoh  Baggi  Tunnel  (PBT).  The  weightage  average  head  of  the  Powerhouse shall be 38.94mThe  proposed  Baggi  Power  Plant  (42  MW)  is  located  very  near  to  National  Highway  No.21 about  12  KM  upstream  of  Sunder Nagar  Town  in  District  Mandi  of  Himachal  Pradesh.
Project Name: Proposed Construction of 2x21MW Baggi, Hydro Electric  Power Project at Baggi, Sunder Nagar, Distt. Mandi,  Himachal Pradesh
Alternative Site Examined: NO

Project Description:
Construction of link road from Davada to Sheel Anu, Km 0/000 to 3/620, in Gram Panchayat Bag, Block Basantpur, Tehsil Sunni, Distt. Shimla, H.P.
	The villages Sheel & Anu are un-connected from road. The land/soil of the area is very fertile in growing cash crops viz, Apples, potatoes, Pulses, Peas & Seasonal Crops etc. But, at present in the absence of motorable road, the people of this village are facing great difficulties in carrying their cash crops timely to the market and also in carrying the essential commodities/daily needs etc. especially in view of the rugged terrain and steep slope. They have to pay huge amounts on account of manual carriage of cash crops and essential commodities, the local products cannot be sent to the market well in time and the growers cannot get the proper values of their cash crops with the result that the people of the area are becoming poor to poorer day by day. Hence, the link road to these villages has been proposed.
Project Name: CONSTRUCTION OF LINK ROAD FROM DAVADA TO SHEEL, ANU KM 0/00 TO 3/620 , GRAM PANCHAYAT BAG, BLOCK BASANTPUR , TEHSIL SUNNI, DISTT. SHIMLA H.P.
Alternative Site Examined: YES
Organization Street: Engineer-in-Chief HPPWD Nirman Bhawan Nigam Vihar Shimla Engineer-in-Chief HPPWD Nirman Bhawan Nigam Vihar Shimla

Project Description: The exists an old kachha forest road which was constructed during the year 1982-83 as per the working plan record of Suket Forest Division. This kachha road is the only link to several villages and also leads to religious site i.e. Mata Murari temple. The up gradation of this existing forest road will not only benefit the locals by enhancing the connectivity for their various means including accessibility, boost to economy but will also cater the needs of thousands of pilgrims and religious devotees who are visiting this area since ages from all parts of the state and outside. In addition, this will also help in the enhancement of ecotourism and activities which are important from forestry point of view.

Project Description: HP.PWD proposed to construct  link  road Shihardi Chamara to Bhere  Ka Khech. The total length of road is 1120 meters out of which 150 meters passing through the forest land. At present there is an existing road from RD 0/915 to 1/065 having roadway width of 4.00 meters, therefore area of the Forest land already used is 150 meters for 4 meters width i.e. 0.06 Ha. The additional forest area to be used for the construction of this road is also from RD 0/915 to 1/065, 3 meters wide in addition to already constructed 4 meters roadway width i.e. 0.045 Ha. Therefore, total area of forest land required is 0.06 + 0.045= 0.105 Hectare.

Project Description: The slope protection work uphill of Narola Village (located in Tehsil Kumarsain, District Shimla) will involve implementing various measures to restrain the falling of individual blocks from the vertical cliff on the slope. To address the vulnerability of the slope, high-strength steel ring nets, high-strength wire rope nets, and reinforced double-twisted hexagonal mesh will be installed. Additionally, in the lower part of the slope, a dynamic barrier and gabion wall will be installed to enhance stability and protection against potential hazards.
Project Name: Slope Protection Works uphill of Village Narola, District Shimla.
Alternative Site Examined: Not applicable as the project or activity is site specific
Organization Street: HOD, Corporate Environment Department, SJVN Ltd., Shanan, Shimla-171006, Himachal Pradesh, India
Organization Legal Status: Central PSU (eg. NHAI, AAI, NTP, CIL, SAIL)

Project Description: Certified that location of all the civil components of the Demolition Waste Management in Mohal  Karian   is feasible in the forest land only. The provisions of Chapter  IV  of the Indian Forests Act, (xvi of 1927), made applicable to all forest land on waste land in Himachal Pradesh which are the property of Government over which the Government has proprietary rights vide Notification No. Ft.-29-241-B5/49 dated 25-02-1952. So there is no Non Forest Land except Private Land in the Chamba District. Thus the Demolition Waste Management in Mohal  Karian has necessarily to be located in the forest land. Moreover the Demolition Waste Management in Mohal  Karian is to be proposed, away from the residential area. No felling of trees is involved in the proposal.
Project Name: Construction of proposed  Demolition Waste Management in Mohal  Karian Tehsil &   Distt. Chamba (HP)

Project Description: Kullu town which is a gateway to Manali, Atal Tunnel, Lahaul and Leh. Kullu is a municipal council town that serves as the administrative headquarters of the Kullu district of the Himachal Pradesh.With the growth of population and worsening infrastructural facilities in the existing areas and neglect of advanced comprehensive development in the new area, the problems may still continue and may become worsen in near future. Not only, increased population is a threat but with the increased number of vehicles is also a major concern. The development and upgradation of highways from single to double to four lane has also increased the vehicles number to manifold. Therefore; keeping in view of the increased populations in the cities and to provide the better well being of the society, it is proposed to have one community centre with multi-storeyed parking at Hanumanibag in Kullu within the limits of MC, Kullu on PPP mode.

Alternative Site Examined: NO

Project Description:
GoHP proposes to construct a tunnel from IGMC to IPH Pump house near St.Bede’s college, Shimla. The proposed tunnel is 890m long (main tunnel) and had an Escape tunnel of length 390m. The tunnel is expected to act as a bypass for the congested Sanjauli Chowk which will relieve the traffic build up at the Sanjauli Chowk (4 legged junction) to a large extent and cut-short the travel length from 3km to 890m on the circular road for all the through traffic. 
Due to the topographic constraints of the area, geometric considerations (alignment and gradient) of the proposed tunnel, and engineering feasibility, this option is the most feasible one. Therefore, the proposal has to be taken through existing forest land since there are no other feasible options in this particular location.
The Application for the forest clearance is being submitted to obtain FC under FCA to allow for the diversion of the forest land.
Project Name: Construction of a two-lane tunnel (length 890 m) with an escape tunnel (length 390 m) from IGMC to IPH Pump House near St. Bede’s College, Shimla, on EPC mode, including all relevant E&M works, approach roads and related peripheral development works, etc.
Alternative Site Examined: NO
Organization Street: Engineer-in-Chief HPPWD Nirman Bhawan Nigam Vihar Shimla Engineer-in-Chief HPPWD Nirman Bhawan Nigam Vihar Shimla

Project Description: The proposed project is a terrace deposit mining project. The extracted sand, stone, and bajri from this quarry shall be used to feed an already established stone crusher unit in the name and style of “M/s Jai Lakshmi Stone Crusher.” The mine lease is located at Khasra Nos. 2885/2713/1 & 2886/2713/1, measuring an area of 01-79-62 hectares (private land, terrace deposit), falling in Mauza/Mohal Raja Khas, Tehsil Indora, District Kangra, Himachal Pradesh. The letter of intent for the grant of the mining lease was issued in favor of Sh. Devi Singh, Partner, M/s Jai Lakshmi Stone Crusher, V.P.O. Kandrori, Tehsil Indora, District Kangra, Himachal Pradesh. It was issued via letter No. Udyog-Bhu(Khani-4)-Laghu-238/2023-12935, dated 15-02-2024
Project Name: Extraction of Sand, Stone & Bajri, at Khasra Nos. 2885/2713/1 & 2886/2713/1, Measuring an area 01-79-62 Hectares (Private land, Terrace deposit) Falling in Mauza/Mohal Raja Khas, Tehsil Indora, District Kangra, Himachal Pradesh, Proposed by Sh. Project Description: The Govt of Himachal Pradesh has issued an intention notification vide letter No. FFE-B-F(6)11/2005 dated 28-07-2010 regarding merger of Sainj Wildlife Sanctuary in Great Himalayan National Park. In view of the decision of World Heritage Committee/conference UNESCO 38th session held at Doha on 23-06-2014. Accordingly the matter was placed before the H.P State Board for Wildlife meeting held on 08-05-2015 for its recommendation. The board was informed/apprised that Sainj Sanctuary would be retained as such and not be amalgamated with the GHNP to allow local communities to continue sustainable activities in the area. The SBWL members agreed and recommended the proposal to NBWL for further approval.
Organization Name: divisional forest officer great himalayan national park shamshi
Project Name: Final Notification of  Wild Life Sanctuary, Sainj
Alternative Site Examined: NO
Alternative Site Description: Not applicable as the project or activity is site specific.

Project Description:
M/s Shree Siddi Vinayak Forging Pvt. Ltd. is an existing Steel Manufacturing Unit located at Village Nangal Uparla, Nalagarh-Swarghat Road, Tehsil Nalagarh, District Solan (H.P). Currently, the existing industrial unit deals with the manufacturing of Ingots @60,000 TPA with 2 Induction Furnaces of capacity 8 TPH & 12 TPH.
Now, the project proponent has proposed expansion by upgrading the existing Induction furnace of capacity 8 TPH to 15 TPH & merging the Rolling Mill unit (M/s Shree Siddi Vinayak TOR Pvt. Ltd.). However, 12 TPH Induction Furnace will remain same.
Thus, after expansion, the overall production capacity of the industrial unit will become 1,20,000 TPA of TMT Bars with 2 Induction Furnaces of capacity 12 TPH & 15 TPH and existing Rolling Mill. The total area of the industrial unit will become 26,525.62 sq.m (6.55 acres or 2.65 ha).
Organization Name: SHREE SIDDI VINAYAK FORGING PVT. LTD.
Project Name: Expansion of the existing Steel Manufacturing Unit namely M/s Shree Siddi Vinayak Forging Pvt. Ltd. located at Village Nangal Uparla, Nalagarh-Swarghat Road, Tehsil Nalagarh, District Solan (H.P)
Alternative Site Examined: NO
Alternative Site Description: The project is expansion of the existing unit within same premises.
Organization Street: Village Nangal Uparla, Nalagarh- Swarghat Road, Tehsil Nalagarh, Distt. Solan, H.P

Project Description: The Govt. of Himachal Pradesh had issued an intention notification vide notification No. FFE-B-F(6)11/2005 dated 28-07-2010 regarding the constitution of new National Park namely Khirganga. As per decision of world Heritage Committee UNESCO 38th Session of Doha Qatar held on 23-06-2014 the amalgamation of Khirganga (proposed) National Park was also placed before the SBWL meeting held on 08-05-2015. The Board was informed/apprised that Khirganga National Park was being amalgamated with the Great Himalayan National Park-an integrated single unit for effective management, administration and executive control.  After the approval of the state wildlife board, the proposal is recommended for NBWL for further approval.
Organization Name: divisional forest officer great himalayan national park shamshi
Project Name: Amalgamation of Khirganga National Park with GHNP.
Alternative Site Examined: NO
Alternative Site Description: Not applicable as the project or activity is site specific.

Project Description: Chhaura small hydro electric project 2.30mw is a run off the river scheme which has been envisaged to utilize the water of Daredi Nala for power generation. The scheme involves construction of weir structure at El. 966M on Daredi nala and total water conductor system of 691 m length including feeder channel and Power pipe on the hill on the right bank of the daredi Nala. Forebay has been fixed at an Elevation 965.29m(Top Level) wherefrom  water shall be dropped through 289m long Penstock into the Power House at Elevation 741M. Water from Power house shall be released into the Nala on its right bank in Gram Panchayat Manola of the Development Block Bhatiyat. The Power generated from the Project shall be evacuated in Bathri Chamba 33 kv feeder of HPSEBL.
Last Visible Status: Pending at Nodal Officer for Recommendation
Project Name: CHHAURA SMALL HYDRO  ELECTRIC PROJECT  (2.30MW)
Alternative Site Examined: Not applicable as the project or activity is site specific
Organization Street: H.No. 6, Villagr Ghiana Khurd, PO Jheol. Tehsil Dharamshala, Distt. Kangra HP-176001

Project Description: The acquisition of 00-27-50 he forest land is applied for development of Military infrastructure at Northern Border at Nagasti in Distt - Kinnaur (HP) for the units & formation of Central Command at Khasra No 18/1 to be utilized by troops of complete middle sector & development of Military infrastructure & security of Northern border and priorities such land for acqn for military use.Bordering area of Himachal Pradesh shares approximately 40 Kms of LAC with China (TAR) which is a mountainous region with altitudes ranging from 9000 to 18000 ft. The area of HQ (I) Inf Bde Gp experiences heavy snowfall in the higher altitudes. The units/sub units deployed in the area & also additional forces which will be inducted in the future needs a well establish development of Military infrastructure to deploy in these terrain to carry out security of border. Hence, there is an urgent need to develop of Military infrastructure at Nagasti for enhanced billeting of troops.
Project Name: Diversion of 00-27-50 Hectare forest land for development of Military Infrastructure at Northern border in favour of 11 MAHAR Regiment / Headquarter 136 (Independent ) Infantry Brigade Group at Nagasti, Tehsil - Sangla, District - Kinnaur (Himachal Pradesh)

Project Description: The Government of Himachal Pradesh has decided to establish Rajiv Gandhi Day Boarding Schools in each Assembly constituency, with a preference that these schools be situated near District Headquarters, Sub-Division Headquarters, or Tehsil Headquarters. To facilitate a comprehensive educational environment, an area of approximately 50 bighas is required to develop the necessary infrastructure. However, the Education Department does not possess sufficient land in the vicinity, and purchasing private land of this extent would incur significant costs. Additionally, no government wasteland is available, as the 1952 notification declared all waste land in Himachal Pradesh as protected forest.
Last Visible Status: Pending at UA for DFO EDS Reply
Project Name: Rajiv Gandhi Day Boarding School at Taruwala, Paonta Sahib Distt. Sirmour HP

Project Description: The Forest land is required for the construction of Kusha tio Sach road. The total length of the road is 12.750 Kms. out of which 10.780Km of road will pass through the forest land and 1.970 km . will passes through private land. This road is being constructed to provide motor lin to the villages Kushwa, Bahan, Doghri, NBarko & Sach. The area produces apples, almonds, patatoes and other ceral crops, the transportation of which to the market is a major problem for the farmers of the area in the absence of road connectivity. Besides this, the motor road will be helpful for the patients in case of medical emergencies. the road will be cater to the needs of population of about 313 and will give a boost to the local economy. For the construction of this road 8.87 hac. of forest land is required to be diverted.

Project Description:
The land for the proposed solar power project is under the possession of HP Government situated in Village Kayarian, District Una, Himachal Pradesh and havingarea 22.10 hectare (approx.).The land is slopy, barren and having most of the area south facing and suitable for construction of solar power project. A considerable area falls under shadow zone due to unfavorable slopes and tree cover. Site is well connected with road. Project site is at 6 KM distance from National Highway-503A which connects Una and Hamirpur. Road is motor able and suitable to carry project equipments by heavy duty transport vehicle. However, approach road from village road to site needs to constructed. Kayarian is blessed with ample solar irradiation, the Global Horizontal Irradiation (GHI) of the site is 4.20 kWh/m2/day. 
The topography of the proposed land is undulating, with a mixture of sand, clay, and boulder-based soil observed at the surface level.
Project Name: Diversion of 22.1 ha forest land in favour of Dy.GM (E)cum HoP Solar Power Projects HP Power Corporation Ltd. Hamirpur  for the setting up of Kyarian Solar Power Project (8 MW) in Village Kyarian, Tehsil Bangana Distt. Una under Una Forest Division Himachal Pradesh
Alternative Site Examined: NO
Alternative Site Description: The land being diverted is not a forest land by ownership of forest department and is not covered by the working plan of Nalagarh Forest Division for management. The land is owned by revenue dcepartment and the control of trees/vegetation vests with forest department. It is categorized as 'khudro drakhtan malkiat sarkar," hence comes under deemed forest category.
Organization Street: HPPCL, Solar power projects, Anu, Hamirpur
Applicant Designation: Dy General Manager (E)  HP Power Corporation Ltd

Project Description:
The Project site is located at Bhangla village of Nalagarh area of Solan district in Himachal Pradesh, the place is well connected via road, and rail. Bhangla is blessed with ample solar irradiation, the Global Horizontal Irradiation (GHI) of the site is 4.20 kWh/m2/day. 
The site is situated approximately 8 kilometers from the Bharatgarh bus stand and is conveniently located along the Bharatgarh-Nalagarh road. This site is well-connected by road, and the condition of the road is good. It is important to note that the entire proposedarea is enveloped by dense tree cover, and only certain sections are open for accessibility.Entire proposed are is covered by densely populated trees and even only certain parts of the proposed site are accessible. 
Based on available maximum utilizable area (after trees cutting and utilized the area of densely populated tree area, it is considered 1.66 Hectares per MW (AC), and a 545 Wp PV module with a proposed capacity of 13 MW (AC)

Project Description:
The deposit was identified at Arki, Dist Solan, Himachal Pradesh in in late 1980s as a potential source to supply SMS grade low silica limestone to integrated steel plants. NMDC explored part of deposit from 1987 to 1992 and estimated 98.34 Million Tons of Mineable reserves with Cao 53.46% and MgO 01.48%. The Mining Lease for Arki Limestone was granted over 238.20 Ha land to NMDC Limited on 23.04.1991. The mining lease was executed on 07.08.1991 for a period of 20 years. The Mining lease was reduced to 232.60Ha after surrendering of 5.6Ha Shakini Forest area. Out of 232.60 Ha lease area, private land is 148.24 Ha and Forest Land is 84.36 Ha.
The Environmental Clearance obtained on 20.12.2010 for a production of 3.0 MTPA subject to transportation of limestone by road initially for 5 years and thereafter by conveyor only.
Description: Application for Surrender of Environmental Clearance - Form -11
Project Name: Arki Limestone Mining Project of M/s. NMDC Limited located in Village(s) Behli, Sujhala, Taal, Sherpur, Jhijawan, Bapron, Seri and Kaug, Teshsil Arki, District Solan, Himachal Pradesh - surrendering of Environmental clearance F No: J-11015/82/2009-IA.II(M) dated 20th December 2010
Alternative Site Examined: Not applicable as the project or activity is site specific

Project Description: With the construction of this road village Trehad, Chhatrel and its surrounding sub village will be improved considerably. These villages falls in the BASP belt of Chamba District and villagers are very poor. The horticulture and agriculture produce such as Peaches, Walnuts, Potatoes and Pulses are grown in the area and people face lot of problems in marketing the above crops for want of the road. The other services like health, education and other development activities will be improved with the construction of this road. The people shall gain employment on the construction activities and activity shall help in ameliorating the poor economy of the area.

Project Description:
Varun Jal Vidyut Shakti Pvt Ltd is implementing Banu SHP (5 MW), construction works have been started and the project is proposed to be commissioned in the year 2024.The transmission line for the evacuation of the power to be generated at Banu plant is proposed in joint mode with Ranital Hydro Ventures Pvt Ltd. The case for diversion of forest land for joint transmission line was prepared bhy Ranital Hydro Ventures Pvt Ltd and In principle clearance was accorded in favour of the company vide letter No.         
Ranital hydro ventures Pvt Ltd has not obtained stage – II clearance for their project. Presently this company is not in a stage to construct the project in the near future. Therefore, is proposed that Varun Jal Vidyut Shakti Pvt Ltd shall construct the new transmission line. Land requirement for the the construction of transmission line is 03.25.50 hectare out which 27.36 hectare land belongs to Binwa Power Project of HPSEBL, total forest area required is02.98.14 hectare.

Project Description: The forest land is required for the construction of Sub-Fire Station Bhattiyat in Chowari, Mohal Gulahad, Tehsil Bhattiyat, District Chamba (H.P.). The proposal involves construction of Sub-Fire Station Building in Gram Panchayat  Turkara in Teshil, Bhattiyat District Chamba. The proposal requires 0.15 hectare of forest land for construction of different components viz., Sub-Fire Station  Building. With the passing of time and increasing population of nearby areas there is an increase in Global Warming. As a result the fire incidents has increased gradually so there is an immense need of a Sub-Fire Station in the area. So the H.P. Project Description: The acquisition of 00-27-50 he forest land is applied for development of Military infrastructure at Northern Border at Nagasti in Distt - Kinnaur (HP) for the units & formation of Central Command at Khasra No 18/1 to be utilized by troops of complete middle sector & development of Military infrastructure & security of Northern border and priorities such land for acqn for military use. Bordering area of Himachal Pradesh shares approximately 40 Kms of LAC with China (TAR) which is a mountainous region with altitudes ranging from 9000 to 18000 ft. The area of HQ (I) Inf Bde Gp experiences heavy snowfall in the higher altitudes. The units/sub units deployed in the area & also additional forces which will be inducted in the future needs a well establish development of Military infrastructure to deploy in these terrain to carry out security of border. Hence, there is an urgent need to develop of Military infrastructure at Nagasti for enhanced billeting of troops.
Project Name: Diversion of 00-27-50 Hectare forest land for development of Military Infrastructure at Northern border in favour of 11 MAHAR Regiment / Headquarter 136 (Independent ) Infantry Brigade Group at Nagasti, Tehsil - Sangla, District - Kinnaur (HIMACHAL PRADESH))

Project Description: Construction of link road from Domehar to village Matlor Km 0/00 to 5/550 , in G.P. Domehar & G.P. Majhiwar, Block Basantpur, Tehsil Sunni, Distt. Shimla, H.P. The village Matlor is un-connected from road. The land/soil of the area is very fertile in growing cash crops viz, Apples, potatoes, Pulses, Peas & Seasonal Crops etc. But, at present in the absence of motorable road, the people of this village are facing great difficulties in carrying their cash crops timely to the market and also in carrying the essential commodities/daily needs etc. especially in view of the rugged terrain and steep slope. They have to pay huge amounts on account of manual carriage of cash crops and essential commodities, the local products cannot be sent to the market well in time and the growers cannot get the proper values of their cash crops with the result that the people of the area are becoming poor to poorer day by day. Hence, the link road to these villages has been proposed .
Last Visible Status: Pending at DFO for Scrutiny and Recommendation
Project Name: CONSTRUCTION OF LINK ROAD FROM DOMEHAR TO VILLAGE MATLOR KM 0/00 TO 5/550, G.P. DOMEHAR & G.P. MAJHIWAR, BLOCK BASANTPUR, TEHSIL SUNNI, DISTT. SHIMLA, H.P.

Project Description:
With growing urbanization and emergence of urban areas as 
growth centers combined with improved living standards, piped water supply with improving service levels has become integral part of basic civic amenity. Safe disposal of human excreta & wastewater is also necessary for health reasons. The options available for disposal of excreta are either on-site or off-site sewerage system. On site sanitation system, prevailing till date, in most of the towns, are individualistic system with inherent problems for collection & disposal of sludge & risks of contamination of ground water. Water carriage sewerage system, more or less, has come to be universally adopted for disposal of excreta. Village Kot in Tehsil Dharmpur has no 
comprehensive sewerage system.
Organization Name: EXECUTIVE ENGINEER IRRIGATION PUBLIC HEALTH DIVISION DHARAMPUR BHARARI
Project Name: Construction of Sewerage Treatment plant of village Kot in Sub-Tehsil Tihra, Distt. Mandi H.P.

Project Description: The Forest land is required for the Bijli to Village Darad Km 0/000 to 4/000. The total length of the road is 4.00 Kms. out of which 3.731 Kms of road will pass through the forest land and 0.269 Kms will pass thorugh private land . This road is being constructed to private motor lin to the village Bijli, Darad, Shadhar, Bihadi & Badnah. The area produces apples, almonds, potatoes and other cereal crops, the transportation of which to the market is a major problem for the farmers of the area in the absence of road connectivity. Besides this, the motor road will be helpful for the patients in case of medical emergencies. The road will cater to the needs of population of about 320 and will give a boost to the local economy. Project Description: Parbati HE Project Stage-II is located in the lesser Himalaya in Distt. Kullu of Himachal Pradesh and is a run of the river scheme to harness the power potential of river Parbati, a left bank tributary of river Beas. The scheme envisages diversion of river Parbati by constructing a concrete gravity Dam 83 m high at village Pulga and the water shall be further conveyed through intake & Desilting arrangement; Head Race Tunnel (6m dia, 31.526 kms long); Surge Shaft (17 m dia, 130 m high) and Pressure Shafts (2 Nos., 3.5 dia each 2156m long) into a surface Power House located at village Suind as per layout map of the project shown in Annex-1. A gross head of 867 m between Pulga and Suind will be utilized for generating 800 MW power through four generating units each of 200 MW capacity. The diverted discharge of the river Parbati shall also be augmented enroute by diverting the discharge of five Nallahs namely Jigrai, Manihar, Pancha, Hurla and Jiwa into the water conductor system.
Description: Form-E: Re-Diversion i) Land Use Change ii) Laying of Overhead/ Under Ground OFC/ drinking water pipeline/ slurry pipeline/ electric cable/ CNG/PNG within RoW
Project Name: Parbati HE Project Stage-II (NHPC Limited)

However, recent amendments to the Himachal Pradesh Minor Minerals (Concession) and Minerals (Prevention of Illegal Mining, Transportation and Storage) Rules, 2015, specifically Rule 34, as per notification no. Ind-B-F(6)-14/2014-III dated September 26, 2024, stipulate that:
“The depth of mining in the river bed shall not exceed 2 meters or the water level, whichever is less”.
Now, the proposal aims to increase the project's production capacity from 49500 MT to 90900 MT of sand, stone & bajri/annum (including silt/clay).

This road will connect the people residing in village Ballah, Kholi, Lower Khatin and Trutibat with direct road connectivity. The proposed road has total length of 3088 m comprising of 2710 m in Forest Land, 285 m in non-forest Govt. Land and 93 m falls in Private Land. The proposal requires 1.8528 ha of total land comprising of 1.6260 ha of Forest Land, 0.1709 ha of non-forest Govt. Land and 0.0559 ha of Private Land. The road is already constructed in Violation of Forest (Conservation) Act, 1980 and proposal is prepared for regularization of violation.

Project Description: Udaipur earlier known as Markul located on the right bank of the Chandrabhaga River. It is situated at an altitude of 2,743 meters above MSL & around 55 Kms from district headquarter Keylong which serves as a popular pilgrimage site for both Hindus as well as Buddhists. Nestled in the middle of lush green forests and beautiful scenic landscapes, Udaipur also serves as a famous camping and trekking site for adventure enthusiasts. The above said area has no dedicated sewerage scheme till today. The human excreta, the grey water from the kitchen & from the bathroom directed disposed off into the open drain by using local site sanitation method resulting into poor environment conditions. Due to non - availability of land with the department, the work for construction of Sewerage Treatment Plant (STP) not started till today. Keeping in view the above facts the detail project is submitted for its necessary sanction & approval from competent authority.
Last Visible Status: Pending at UA for DFO EDS Reply
Organization Name: EXECUTIVE ENGINEER IPH DIVISION LAHAUL AT KEYLONG
Project Name: Construction of Sewerage Scheme Udaipur in GP Udaipur District Lahaul & Spiti (H.P.)
Alternative Site Examined: YES
Organization Street: O/O EXECUTIVE ENGINEER,JAL SHAKTI DIVISION KEYLONG

Project Description: The Scheme Proposed to lift the water from Beas River & Irrigate the Agricultural field of Jawalamukhi area. The project area divided into 23 zones. Seven zones  are already getting the irrigation facilities . In the instant proposal department is keen to provide assured irrigation for rest of 16 Zones. The proposed scheme shall cover the approximately 2590 Hectare CCA Area, situated on the right bank of Beas River in 16 zones . The project proposed to cover 116 villages & 21 Nos. panchayats . The project shall benefit to 41315 Nos. population as per census 2011.  The proposed project has already been approved by Advisory Committee of MoWR ,RD & GR in the 131st meeting dated on 16.11.2016 for the estimated cost of Rs. 194.47 Cr.  The main Component of the project are Intake structure, De-silting tank, Collection Tank, pump House, Main Delivery tank ,Sector/Zonal tank, Pumping Machinery, Main Gravity Pipe, Distribution System, Outlet and field Channels.
Last Visible Status: Proposal Accepted and Referred to EAC

Project Description:
The proposal for the diversion of 33.8599 hectares of forest land for the rehabilitation and upgradation of the existing road to a 4-lane configuration with paved shoulders—from Kolaka Village (near Shalaghat) to Nauni Chowk [Design Chainage km 28+800 to km 58+450] of NH-205—has been uploaded on the PARIVESH portal [Proposal No. FP/HP/ROAD/156128/2022]. Stage-I approval for the project was granted by IRO, MOEF&CC, Chandigarh (Sub-office Shimla) on 19.03.2025.
However, during the joint inspection conducted with the Forest Department, certain forest plots located along the proposed alignment (between chainage km 28+800 to Km 44+100) were found to be excluded from the original diversion proposal. Consequently, submission of an additional forest diversion proposal became necessary to address these shortfalls. The additional forest land proposed for diversion is estimated to be 3.6736 ha, falling under the jurisdiction of the Kunihar Forest Division.
Last Visible Status: Pending at DFO for Scrutiny and Recommendation
Project Name: Additional Area Requirement for Rehabilitation and Upgrading of Existing Road to 4 Lane with Paved Shoulder from Kolaka to Nalag Village of NH 205 [Km 28+800 to Km 44+100] in the State of Himachal Pradesh

Project Description:
The proposed road alignment from Katli to 
Village Gabbar is 4.300 km in length, with the 
entire stretch passing through forest land. An 
exhaustive survey of the region has confirmed the 
unavailability of adequate private land suitable 
for road construction. The existing private land 
parcels are either fully utilized for agricultural 
purposes or are economically unfeasible for 
acquisition due to their size, location, or 
ownership complexities. Landowners rely on 
their holdings for livelihood, and any attempt to 
acquire additional land would disrupt their 
income sources and may not be legally 
permissible. The total length of the proposed road 
is 4/300 km, Whole alignment passing through 
the forst land. The total land involved in this 
alignment is 2.9400 hectares in forest land. The 
proposed road falls under Renuka ji Forest

Project Description: The forest land is required for the construction of Fire Post Salooni in Kuntedi, Mouja Kuntedi, Tehsil Salooni, District Chamba (H.P.). The proposal involves construction of Fire Post Building in Gram Panchayat  Salooni  in Teshil, Salooni District Chamba. The proposal requires 0.08094 hectare of forest land for construction of different components viz., Fire Post Building and open area. With the passing of time and increasing population of nearby areas there is an increase in Global Warming. As a result the fire incidents has increased gradually so there is an immense need of a Fire Post in the area. So the H.P. Govt. has approved the construction of Fire Post in Salooni Valley  to be built in Salooni in Tehsil Salooni, District Chamba. The total land involved for construction of the above project will be 0.08094 hectare.

Project Description: The proposed project is a riverbed mining project intended for the extraction of stone, sand, and bajri. These materials will be utilized in the proposed stone crusher unit, M/s S.R.S. Enterprises. After screening and washing, the sand will be sold in the open market; stone and bajri will be used for the manufacture of grit and M-sand. The mining lease area is located at Khasra No. 3/1, with a total area of 35-15 bighas. The land is privately owned and situated on the riverbed within Mauza Haripur Khol, Tehsil Paonta Sahib, District Sirmour, Himachal Pradesh. The Letter of Intent (LOI) for the grant of mining lease has been issued in favour of M/s S.R.S. Enterprises, through its partners Smt. Deepika Chauhan and Sh. Devesh Sharma, residents of Dev Bhawan, RSVN School, P.O. & Tehsil Shillai, District Sirmour, Himachal Pradesh. The Letter of Intent was issued by the Department of Industries vide letter No. Udyog-Bhu (Khani-4) Laghu-632/2025-II-3022, dated 17.06.2025

Project Description: The mining lease area is located on a hill slope, with the highest elevation recorded at 1,354 meters above Mean Sea Level (MSL) and the lowest elevation at 1,314 meters above MSL. This results in an overall elevation difference of approximately 40 meters across the site. The lease area falls within private land and is characterized by a gently undulating hill slope. The vegetation cover is sparse. consisting mainly of small bushes and scattered plants. The topography of the mine site area will be changed into a terrace form. The mined-out area shall be utilized for afforestation. As per the revenue record, the land is classified as Ghasni Banjar, Kadeem, and Gair Mumkin Toda (private land).

Project Description: The Scheme Proposed to lift the water from Beas River & Irrigate the Agricultural field of Jawalamukhi area. The project area divided into 23 zones. Seven zones  are already getting the irrigation facilities . In the instant proposal department is keen to provide assured irrigation for rest of 16 Zones. The proposed scheme shall cover the approximately 2590 Hectare CCA Area, situated on the right bank of Beas River in 16 zones . The project proposed to cover 116 villages & 21 Nos. panchayats . The project shall benefit to 41315 Nos. population as per census 2011.  The proposed project has already been approved by Advisory Committee of MoWR ,RD & GR in the 131st meeting dated on 16.11.2016 for the estimated cost of Rs. 194.47 Cr.  The main Component of the project are Intake structure, De-silting tank, Collection Tank, pump House, Main Delivery tank ,Sector/Zonal tank, Pumping Machinery, Main Gravity Pipe, Distribution System, Outlet and field Channels.
Project Name: Providing Medium Irrigation Project to Various Panchayats of Jawalamukhi Area in Distt. Kangra HP
Alternative Site Examined: Not applicable as the project or activity is site specific

Project Description:
The project has been granted Environmental Clearance vide file no. HPSEIAA/2013/223-1-M/s New Shiva Stone Crusher dated 15.10.2015, and extension in EC vide file no. HPSEIAA/2013/223-674-681 dated 31.08.2022, for an annual production of 47,200 MT. As per the approved Mining Plan at that time, the permissible depth of mining was restricted to 1.0 meter in compliance with prevailing rules. However, subsequent to the amendments in the Himachal Pradesh Minor Minerals (Concession) and Minerals (Prevention of Illegal Mining, Transportation & Storage) Rules, 2015, vide Notification No. Ind-B-F(6)-14/2014-III dated 26.09.2024, Rule 34 now allows that:
“The depth of mining in the river bed shall not exceed 2 meters or the water level, whichever is less”.
Accordingly, we are now seeking amendment in the existing Environmental Clearance for increase of production capacity from 47,200 MT to 1,51,248 MT per annum (including silt/clay).
